that was NOT a fisheye distortion, it was a RECTILINEAR distortion (fisheye is when the edges of the frame get small and straignt lines curve outward fom the center)
RECTILINEAR is when the edges of the frame get stretched, but no straight line gets bent, only the angles between them get distorted

Just three quick things about PCs/Macs (if any of this sounds rude, it’s unintentional and I am sorry): PCs can often have even better video editing performance than Macs since they usually have better cooling solutions and often can find processors just as good if not better, also allowing you to customize it. They (PCs) also are usually cheaper and extremely customizable (when could you get an insane sound card like the Soundblaster X Ae-5 in a Mac?). Lastly, (anyone tech crazy and watches a bunch of tech youtubers will probably know what I’m talking about) Apple literally refuses or doesn’t even now how to fix their iMac pro if something happens to it (might be fixed by now, but might be something to check out.) Slitt, you make the choice. You could probably port the tunes and things over to a PC, but who knows? It’s your computer, do what you want.
Edit: I just noticed I’m over a year late, so you likely already have your new Mac. How is it? But there may be som useful info here still, I dunno.
